thread.title: Bliss n Eso: Mourners farewell Johann Ofner, shot dead during music video clip in Brisbane | The Courier-Mail
thread.title_full: Bliss n Eso: Mourners farewell Johann Ofner, shot dead during music video clip in Brisbane | The Courier-Mail

title: Bliss n Eso: Mourners farewell Johann Ofner, shot dead during music video clip in Brisbane | The Courier-Mail
text:
Mourners farewell Johann Ofner, shot dead during music video clip in Brisbane Jeremy Pierce, The Courier-Mail February 11, 2017 1:56pm 
HUNDREDS of mourners have gathered to celebrate the life of Johann Ofner, the rising star killed during the production of a music video clip in Brisbane last month. 
The 28-year-old, a junior tennis star, martial arts expert and fitness fanatic, was fatally wounded working as an extra on a Bliss n Echo film clip on January 23. 
His life was remembered at the Sacred Heart Church at Clear Island Waters on the Gold Coast, where a large crowd remembered an inspirational figure who seized life and chased his dreams. 
In a heartfelt tribute read to the congregation, his girlfriend Kati Garnett recalled the love of her life, while his extended family reassured the Australian Ninja Warrior competitor’s young daughter that angels are very clever and would always watch over her. media_camera Friends and relatives carry the coffin of Johann Ofner, the stuntman who was killed while filming a music video in Brisbane, during his funeral at the Sacred Heart Church, Clear Island Waters, Gold Coast. Photo: Regi Varghese 
Friends from his martial arts studio were also part of the huge gathering, reminiscing about his upcoming role on the Ninja Warrior TV show, while others wore white AMPM shirts acknowledging his fitness training business. 
The man affectionately known as ‘Yogi’ was excited to be part of the Bliss n Esso video clip but suffered two gunshot wounds to the chest, inflicted at close range. media_camera Johann Ofner, affectionately known as ‘Yogi’. 
Paramedics rushed to the bar but were unable to revive the father-of-one. He died at the scene. 
No one has been charged over his death. 
Gofundme pages have been set up to support Mr Ofner’s family, while it is hoped a new outdoor fitness set can be established in his honour at a park in Burleigh. Most viewed
